review_title: Fantastic to learn and develop your skills
pros: - Various opportunities to grow and develop skills as a clinician. -Good pay compared to other organizations. -Training opportunities. -Supervision offered while completing licensure.
cons: -Lots of driving. -EHP can be annoying at times to use.

pros: Encourage employees to work together as a team.
cons: There is a need for updated systems and better organization.

pros: Very friendly and family oriented. Once in, you can move to a better paying position. This employer is so stable people tend to retire after many years. i love it here.
cons: They only operate within Miami-Dade County.

pros: Stability Professionalism Care to patients Culture Location
cons: Low Salary Management No room for growth No flexibility on schedule

pros: The individuals who work there are a joy to work with, the environment is great.
cons: They can be disorganized when it comes to the hiring process that can drag out, along with not properly providing enough training time/resources for the new hires.

review_title: The best place to feel like you are making a difference
pros: Opportunities to grow, great benefits, great work environment, they treat you with respect and dignity.
cons: You have to be ready to have a flexible schedule

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Hialeah, FL
pros: job was alright no pay changes
cons: understaffed office, lots of paperwork

job_title: Case Manager in Pembroke Pines, FL
pros: good communication with employers and flexible time

pros:
-Friendly coworkers
-Good work environment
-Competitive Pay

pros: Some flexibility and autonomy. Staff is friendly but things could get a bit tense. No potential for growth and salaries are not great.
cons: Environment could be very toxic. Management does not seem to care about the person or respect the choices that the employee makes on their own. There’s a lack of attention to what the employees need.

pros: Cliche but feels like working with family. Very friendly and social. Lots of opportunities to grow. You feel like you're doing your part for society.
cons: Intense, stressful at times. Lots of work.

review_title: Great start to my clinical journey
pros: Free supervision, great experience with clients
cons: Paperwork is due within 48 hours

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Hialeah, FL
pros: Flexible hours on a weekly basis
cons: No pay raises given at this position

review_title: I have worked for this organization for 30 years and have been very satisfied with their employment values and direction
job_title: Director of Pharmacy in Hialeah, FL
pros: They have allowed me to run the Pharmacy in a very professional manner and backed all my projects, objectives and goals.
cons: The population we serve is mostly indigent. We became a 340b pharmacy to get better pricing. We are able to serve a greater patient load via a government grant to obtain automation equipment All these changes were very long term programs and difficult to implement.

review_title: It's been a great school for me.
pros: Very organized, great quality assurance, there's always opportunities for growth, little turn out rate, highly qualified staff, diversity of programs, supportive staff, very influential and well respected organization in South Florida.
cons: Avatar EHR. It makes staff work harder. Other than that CHN is one of the most solid organizations in South Florida in its field.

pros: I have a passion of making a difference in some one life everyday, which is what i  do at Citrus.
cons: I work with teenagers, they can be very challenging, how ever at the end the day, i feel great knowing i made a different is their lives.

review_title: Non profit Company and Family business.
pros: Good salary and good co workers
cons: Family Company every body are relatives and is dysfunctional most of the time...nepotism from Administration

pros: Nice co-workers and supervisors. The working environment make you feel almost at home.
cons: Very low pay, except if you are a doctor or have an administrative degree/background.
